required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Effectiveness of the Use of a Novel Crosslinking Hyaluronan Hydrogel on the Prevention of the Adhesion Occurrence After Trigger Finger Release Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Randomized, Evaluator/Subject-blinded, Control Clinical Study: to Evaluate the Effectiveness of the Use of a Novel Crosslinking Hyaluronan Hydrogel on the Prevention of the Adhesion Occurrence After Trigger Finger Release Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: To Evaluate the Effectiveness of the use of a Novel Crosslinking Hyaluronan Hydrogel on the Prevention of the Adhesion Occurrence After Trigger Finger Release Surgery

primary_outcome.measure: The percentage of Total Active Motion (TAM) score for target finger.
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of Total Active Motion (TAM) score for target finger at 30 days post-operation.

secondary_outcome.measure: The percentage of TAM score of target finger.
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of TAM score of target finger at baseline, 14, 60, 90, and 180 days post-operation.
TAM score of target finger at baseline, 14, 30, 60, 90, and 180 days post-operation.

secondary_outcome.measure: The grade of TAM score of target finger and contralateral finger.
secondary_outcome.description: The grade of TAM score of target finger and contralateral finger at baseline, 14, 30, 60, 90, and 180 days post-operation

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjects self-evaluating Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) in pain of target finger at baseline, 14, 30, 60, 90, and 180 days post-operation.
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects self-evaluating Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) in pain of target finger at baseline, 14, 30, 60, 90, and 180 days post-operation. The VAS scale uses a 100 mm line labelled at '0' with 'no pain' and '100' with 'worst pain'

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjects self-evaluating Quick Disabilities of the Arm, Shoulder and Hand Score (Quick-Dash).
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects self-evaluating Quick Disabilities of the Arm, Shoulder and Hand Score (Quick-Dash) at baseline, 14, 30, 60, 90, and 180 days post-operation.

secondary_outcome.measure: The evaluation of tendon by sonography.
secondary_outcome.description: The evaluation of tendon by sonography at baseline, 14, 30, 60, 90, and 180 days post-operation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjects self-evaluating Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) in satisfaction
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects self-evaluating satisfaction at 14, 30, 60, 90, and 180 days post-operation. Patients rate their treatment satisfaction based on a 100 mm VAS. The VAS scale uses a 100 mm line labelled at '0' with 'least satisfaction' and '100' with 'highest satisfaction'.

secondary_outcome.measure: The incidence, severity and correlation of adverse event (AE) and serious adverse event (SAE).
secondary_outcome.description: The incidence, severity and correlation of adverse event (AE) and serious adverse event (SAE).
